text: Shrek the Third (2007) already started to lose the quality of the first two, but it's still a fun movie to watch and enjoy.

Disappointment. This movie had the potential to be the best, but turns out to be the worst one. The first act is okay, but the movie is on downfall afterwards. Toilet humor, none of the charm or heart of 1-2, feels like Illumination before Illumination. The animation is blander than ever. The new characters are completely forgettable, trash villain.
It's a decent movie, but nothing special. Honestly, the most forgettable of the saga.
Shrek the Third is the worst Shrek movie but still entertaining.
Not that funny and kind of annoying.  My kid liked it.

Shrek the Third brings more fairy tale fun and quirky humour, though it’s a bit lighter on the heart of the first two films. Still, it’s an entertaining ride with lovable characters and silly adventures.
66%. 9/28/25. Not nearly as good as the first two. The writing for Donkey and Puss isn't nearly as good. Pretty boring story. Didn't bring out the best of the characters. 1/5 rewatch

The first two Shrek films were clever, satirical fairy-tale adventures with a surprising amount of emotional depth. They balanced crude humor with sharp writing, layered characters, and heartfelt moments.

Shrek the Third abandons that balance entirely.

The animation isn't as impresive like the past movies the fact that the production of this movie started somewhere in 2006 makes you think it was rushed made with no love.

The jokes are incredibly boring, dull, stupid and worst of all, it's not funny. the only good joke was probably that one where donkey went to college but even with being saud i didn't even laugh, chuckle or even smile at that joke

Every single characters was somehow unlikeble 
The welsh wizard, the princesses, shrek, puss and even donkey aren't good writing like they should
ESPECCIALY PRINCE CHARMING AND ARTHUR they are so beyond abysmal characters PRINCE CHARMING is an annoying selfish spoiled idiot that im glad he died during the end and ARTHUR does not deverve to be the king of far far away

The plot is pretty predictable at every point the fact that prince charming is the villian AGAIN and also throws a entire musical like sequense makes it one of the worst IF NOT THE WORST VILLIAN AND THE WORST SCENE IN DREAMWORKS'S FILMOGRAPHY 

The story revolves around Shrek trying to avoid being king by finding Arthur to take the throne — meanwhile, Prince Charming leads a coup.
Problems:

The stakes feel incredibly low. There’s no urgency or believable danger.

The “road trip to find Arthur” takes up most of the runtime and barely develops anyone’s character.

Charming’s villain plot should’ve been tense and dramatic, but it’s treated like a side quest until the last 15 minutes.

The final resolution (Arthur giving a speech to bad guys) is anticlimactic to the point of absurdity.

(Jesus Christ, they can't even write a good speech the live up the mood correctly)

Shrek the Third has… a few forgettable pop covers slapped into montages. Nothing that sticks in your memory or feels tied to the narrative.
(They can't be compared to the golden musical masterpiece like All Star)

Shrek the third ads nothing to the shrek franchise and now i understand why people sticken it from the shrek saga

Dreamworks deliverd a movie that's terrible that the only "OKAY" thing is prince charming's death scene its kinda satisfactory

The pacing is very slow it's 90 minutes but stuff like bad jokes, pointless scenes drags a lot

Yes, out of the first three movies is it the weakest one but it isn't bad. Prince Charming is a threatening antagonist, Shrek as a father was a natural step into his developement and yes, King Artus wasn't the best developed character but He was fine.

As I have said in my recent review of Shrek Forever After. I have been watching the Shrek movies since I was born and is still on of my favorite franchises. There's something about this one that just always make me watch it again and again, just like all Shrek movies, especially forever after. it's one of my Top 10 favorite movies, 100/100 score, and I can wait for Shrek 5 to come out.
